qas.question: What event produced further adaptations during  the Jurassic and Cretaceous periods?

context: The <a0_0><b5_0>climatic changes<b5_0/><a0_0/> of the late <b6_0>Jurassic<b6_0/> and Cretaceous provided for further adaptive radiation. The <a1_0>Jurassic<a1_0/> was the height of archosaur diversity, and the first birds and eutherian mammals also appeared. <a2_0><b7_0>Angiosperms<b7_0/><a2_0/> radiated sometime in the early Cretaceous, first in the tropics, but the even <b8_0>temperature gradient<b8_0/> allowed them to spread toward the poles throughout the period. By the end of the Cretaceous, <a3_0>angiosperms<a3_0/> dominated tree floras in many areas, although some evidence suggests that biomass was still dominated by <a4_0><b9_0>cycad and ferns<b9_0/><a4_0/> until after the Cretaceous–Paleogene extinction.
